storyInfo: A volcano robbed Eyjafjalla of her parents and also ruined her health, yet she still tranquilly continues her pursuit of the truth.

attributes.content: 4:32 PM \ Overcast
Leithanien Northern Wastelands, Volcanic Belt Sampling Site #7
Please rest assured, this mission has come to a smooth conclusion. Operator Eyjafjalla is very tired, but her health is stable.

Though the specific results of this expedition are still unclear, judging from Eyjafjalla's reactions, there should be some semblance of progress, albeit small and hardly worthy of being called a breakthrough.
On the way back, I will continue to make sure that she...
Barty?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Oh...! Um, Eyjafjalla! D-Did you need something?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Um... that device on the front left-hand side seems to have shifted a bit, and background noise from its real-time data has suddenly started fluctuating...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Would you mind helping me see what's going on?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: S-Sorry!
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I was the one who moved it! I'm really sorry, I... I wasn't trying to peek at the data—
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Hmm... I see, so you were looking at the data?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: *cough*—*cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: In that case... all is well then. I thought the wind shifted it, so this at least saves us from having to check all the other devices.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Huh...? Wow, you're not upset with me at all?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: You're not going to chew me out for looking through your data?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Chew? S-Sorry, I'm not sure I heard you clearly... But I'm assuming you're asking if I'm bothered by something?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I wouldn't say bothered, but there is something I'm curious about. I didn't think you'd be interested in my research data.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Haha... You have a point. An old dunce like me...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: That's not what I'm trying to say.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: It's just that volcanology isn't exactly the most exciting thing in the world. Most of the time, you head out into the wilderness like this, sit here and observe things all day, then bury yourself in data analysis after you get back... Most people would find that boring, right?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Boring, huh? If you really break it down, most people in this world lead pretty boring lives.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Every day, you get out of bed, you eat, you keep yourself busy with work all day, then you go to sleep at night.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: But a scholar like you is always exploring new things. Isn't that a lot more interesting?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: (She laughed!) H-Hey, did I really say something that stupid?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: No, not at all. The way you were talking just reminded me of someone I used to go to school with.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Hah, is that so? I've also had my fair share of dealing with those collegiate types in the past.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Huh? Haven't you always been doing security work?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Oh, it's a really old story. Back then... I was only able to land a start-up job opportunity thanks to the compassion of a young faculty member.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: He helped me out a lot, and also made me realize that research is something that is both meaningful and... Uhh, how do I put this. Not that simple? Yeah, not that simple.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Through my last conversation with Dr. Kal'tsit, I learned that you were working at Rhodes Island. I also have another request...
It's about Miss Naumann... She's currently at Rhodes Island under the name of Eyjafjalla.
She's the only child of my esteemed teacher...
Barty, I hope that you'll watch over her to the best of your abilities.
Not just her physical well-being. Her Oripathy is rather severe...
There's also her research work.
Please keep an eye on her progress and contact me if necessary.
Kahn...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit passed this letter on to me before we left, but she should know... Even if you didn't ask me, I'd still look after Eyjafjalla.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: By the way, your first volcano expedition was several years ago, right?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Mhm, my first expedition... I think it would've been about three years back?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Seriously? You were still a kid!
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: (whispers) Are research institutes so black-hearted these days?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: My hearing aid's working fine now. I heard all of that.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Ah, I wasn't talking about Rhodes Island! P-Please don't get the wrong idea!
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: I'm just joking... William University never asked that of me either. Even back then, the school didn't support me enrolling that early.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: It's just that I was the only one who could make sense of the data my parents left behind.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I didn't want the project to be terminated... and my parents wouldn't have wanted that either. So, I insisted on joining the expedition in their place.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: What happened to... Oh! I'm so sorry, I almost forgot that your parents are...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: It's fine, Barty. It was a long time ago.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Was it because of... a volcano?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Yes... Volcanoes are very dangerous. My mom taught me when I was little.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: —A tongue of flame is enough to swallow an entire house. But a volcano... is a behemoth with primal energies in its belly.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: The behemoth may not be sentient, but every time it opens its mouth to breathe or cough, it reshapes the earth effortlessly.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: It's a bit ironic. When I was little, I didn't really understand what my mom and dad were doing. In my mind, I just saw them as brave warriors who challenged behemoths.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Hey, that's not that much of an exaggeration, is it? They knew it was dangerous, but they went off and did it anyway. That takes courage!
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: It's also terrifying.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: When I saw a volcano for the first time... my eyes weren't like they are now. I could see clearly, and my ears were still keen.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Even now, I still clearly remember the bright red, the roar in my ears... It was like a monster breaking free from the shackles of the earth, screeching as it clawed its way forward.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: It was nothing like the textbooks... it was so real, alive.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I... I remember my legs locking up. I couldn't walk. I didn't even dare exhale for the longest time, up until I couldn't hold it anymore. I was coughing, with tears streaming down my eyes.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: In that moment, I understood.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Understood... what?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Well, a lot of things.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I understood why before every expedition, my mom would squeeze into bed with me and hug me tight, until I fell asleep.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I understood why after every expedition, my dad would pat my head while sifting through his data, talking over and over about how grateful he was.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I think... they must've felt that fear every time they set out.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: It's amazing how strong you are, even having lived through all of that.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: I've heard about all kinds of tragedies, like losing a child to a raging river. The parents end up hating the river and move far away.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Back then... I think I also heard stuff like that.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: The day after my parents' accident, everyone I knew came to see me, especially after they heard I was going to join the volcano expedition.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I knew where they were coming from, and respected that. They were worried I was too impulsive, making quick decisions in my grief.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Most of them hoped I would let go of everything and keep going to school like normal, but that was impossible for me.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Eyjafjalla... You really don't hold a grudge at all?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: After Professor Naumann's accident, I've been struggling to uncover the cause of the tragedy...
I have difficulty believing that a top volcanologist, along with her husband who was skilled in Originium Arts, could die in such an unremarkable volcanic incident.
Their research had already attracted too much attention. The truth was not the only thing on their journey of discovery.
There were those who sought to exploit the fruits of their labor, and there were others yet who sought to forever bury those findings beneath the flow of volcanic debris.
Adele is still young, and I'm not sure she can understand how dangerous this research is. She unfortunately contracted Oripathy, even before the accident.
I trust Rhodes Island, just as Dr. Kal'tsit trusts me.
I only wish that Adele would stop what she's doing... but as Dr. Kal'tsit said, I should wait to see what she's like after she's grown up.
I'm still tied down by my work, so I've asked Dr. Kal'tsit to find you in my stead, Barty.
Please take good care of her for me...
I hope that before it is too late, you will do everything you can for her, protect her body and mind from the harms of the outside world, keep her from the gaze of the dark clouds above her.
In any case, volcanoes took away your parents... and caused your illness...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Yes...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I guess there is a little bit of resentment that... I can't escape from.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: No, I shouldn't say resentment. Sadness would be a better word.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I miss them so much... my mom and my dad... When I first heard the news, I couldn't even believe it.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: My dad's Arts were so powerful... and my mom had been on so many expeditions.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: The next few nights after that, I would fall asleep in a stupor. I would always see those volcanoes in my dreams, and I would wake up screaming and crying... There was nothing strong about me at all.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: No, no! That's human nature! Not to mention, you were so young at the time!
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: When you put it that way, my colleagues on the expedition team had to look after a sniveling, crying kid while trying to carry out their survey work. It must've been hard on them as well.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Hmm... I guess I really should write a few more thank-you letters when I get the chance.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Hahaha...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: At least, I started to pull myself together after I saw a volcano with my own eyes for the first time.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Huh? Didn't you just say you were terrified of volcanoes?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Yes, I was. But on top of that terror, I also felt a hint of peace. It doesn't make much sense, does it?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Peace, huh? I... can't say I expected that answer.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Inevitably, I started to think of my mom and dad. At that moment, I suddenly thought, was I seeing the same volcano they had seen?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: And all the scholars who came before us, was this what they had seen as well? Even after hundreds of years— even if the locations were completely different, it could be the same boiling lava flowing in front of all of us.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Even if I never got sick, even if the accident never happened, even if I spent my entire life dedicated to studying it... How much could I possibly have figured out the secrets of the eternal behemoth in front of me?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: 'Why did mom and dad choose this path?' 'Why did mom and dad have to die?'
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: In front of an eternal, inscrutable question... My questions suddenly seemed so insignificant.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I don't have nearly enough time left here. I don't have any more excuses to shy away, or to keep wallowing in grief and fear.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Eyjafjalla...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: I'm sure... mom and dad felt the same way.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I've taken the data they left behind and continued in their footsteps. Now, it's as if they never left this world. They continue to live on in front of me, guiding me forward.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: If... one day, I also have to leave this world, there will be someone after me who continues my work where I left off, right?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Incredible... This way, your work will continue to be passed down again and again, it's a kind of immortality.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Hmm... immortality? I've never looked at it that way... *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Damn it, did the wind pick up again?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Have a seat here, Eyjafjalla. Being exposed to the wind isn't good for you.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*... Thanks. Yes, I'm already much better now.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: After yakking on all this time, you might've gotten the wrong idea about me, Barty... Really, I'm not that brave.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I just... can't help but think back to an expedition I went on a few years ago.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I was in much better shape back then than I am now. Though I still wasn't very strong, at least I wouldn't bump into things left and right and drag everyone else down.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Nonsense, you haven't been dragging any of us down at all. If anything, you've been looking after us more than anything else.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: So cold... Th-The wind's so strong...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Ugh... Even through all these layers, my hands and feet are still shaking...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Hm, now that I think about it, you always struggle with the cold, but every time we get close to you, you seem to run really hot.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: That'd be my Arts... It might be something I subconsciously do because I always feel too cold.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Sorry, Barty. You should keep your distance from me if you don't want to risk getting burned.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: No need to worry about me. As long as you feel a bit more comfortable, I don't care how hot it gets.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: It doesn't actually help. It's just a subconscious reaction anyway, all it gives me is a tiny bit of psychological comfort. In the end, I just go right back to making a fool of myself, shivering all over the place.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Barty, don't you think that with my Originium Arts, and as a Caprinae, the cold shouldn't bother me so much?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Truthfully... I wasn't always like this.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Don't worry about it. N-Next time, just make sure to bring even more layers!
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Hmm... Some extra clothes, huh...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I should also get my hearing aids adjusted. I'm always mishearing things halfway through, and that's been a bit of a headache for you, hasn't it?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Say... Eyjafjalla... Y-Your leg...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Hm? What's wrong with my leg?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Oh... It seems to be moving on its own...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Haha, are you moving to a beat? I bet it's probably because of that guy, sitting in a faraway place, always singing to himself.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: ♪ The snow continues to fall
♪ Everything becomes silent, gradually, quietly
♪ With love for this dance, and even more for the distant mountains
♪ All my hopes and desires
♪ Spread across this great, free land
♪ Where nobody can stop me
I seem to hear it... but also not hear it...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Hmm... This song is something I heard when I was young. Before I realized it, it kept echoing in my head.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: You've also started to hum along...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: You know, I gotta say, I'm relieved to see you like that.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Kahn, about that thing you asked me to do—
You were worried she could be in danger, caught up in something bad. You were worried she could get hurt, so you asked me to look after Miss Naumann— Eyjafjalla.
I understand your concern, but I have to say—
You really don't need to worry about her.
The magma melted her heart and now it's growing back. It's the purest, most resolute thing in the world.
The way I see it, the dark clouds above her cast no shadows on her light.
